articles.content: A minimum of three players would need to fail the NRL's pre-match COVID-19 temperature screening tests before officials make a decision on whether to cancel a game, says a top official of the sport.… [+1982 chars]

articles.title: Socceroos keeper Langerak catches coronavirus - The World Game
articles.description: Socceroos goalkeeper Mitch Langerak is facing a stint on the sidelines after testing positive for coronavirus at J.League club Nagoya Grampus.
articles.content:
Langerak, 31, did not report any symptoms but became the second player at the Japanese club to become infected, the J.League club confirmed.
Teammate and striker Mu Kanazaki registered a positive te… [+825 chars]

articles.title: Australia is 'finally' acting on talk of 'self-reliance, security, and sovereignty' - Sky News Australia
articles.description:
Liberal Senator Jim Molan says Australia has “finally stopped just talking about self-reliance, security, and sovereignty” and instead has started to act amid major changes to foreign investment laws.

articles.title: Newcastle defeats Canberra 34-18, Gold Coast beats Wests Tigers 28-23 in NRL fourth round - ABC News
articles.description: The Newcastle star helps the Knights maintain their unbeaten start to the season with a 34-18 win over premiership favourites Canberra, while Gold Coast snaps a 14-match losing streak to beat the Wests Tigers.
articles.content:
Kalyn Ponga has put on a show and teenager Bradman Best has given Newcastle a glimpse of the future to help the Knights shock Canberra 34-18 at Campbelltown.

articles.title: Amanda Nunes makes more UFC history after ridiculous KO frenzy - Fox Sports
articles.description: Amanda Nunes can’t find anyone to actually test her at the moment.
articles.content:
